Comment: Yes I did read the article and the poll questions were a web survey.    Right after college I worked for  a real public opinion polling company so I know something about how to put together a proper public opinion survey.   We had both commercial and political customers.     Doing it properly is expensive and difficult in order to avoid selection biases, and we typically spent at least a half an hour talking to each person that we polled - some in person some by telephone. This was in the late 1970s. We would often ask the same question multiple ways and we spent a lot of time qualifying the respondents. We picked them; they didn't pick us.   Doing reliable surveys these days is almost impossible.  Web surveys are inherently self-selective and therefore not to be trusted as good data.
